buginformation.summary: Image flickers during send
buginformation.description: I just wrote a message to a group and lost my wifi connection. After I hit 'send', an image shown in a message above started flickering rapidly. The flickering only stopped after the message was eventually delivered. Could it be the case that the image is repeatedly redrawn with each attempt to send the message?

buginformation.summary: group notifications in notification drawer just shows the sender not the group name
buginformation.description: when i get a group message it always just shows the sender in the notification drawer instead of a combination with the group name. at your daily business you maybe don't want to tap for every update in your group discussions, but you want to answer your private chats. at the moment you can not differentiate between private and group messages at your notification drawer. this is how it looks like at the moment: and something like that would be awesome ;-)

buginformation.summary: sms characters remaining don't account for encoding
buginformation.description: When composing a new message, the number of required SMSes are calculated based on the type of characters (Cyrillic or Latin) used in the first message of the thread rather than on the characters used for composition. 1 SMS = 60 Cyrillic or 160 Latin characters.

buginformation.summary: Pending picture
buginformation.description: Today I received a message (group, push) containing a picture. Presumable my phone lost the internet connection during transfer. Now I am stuck with a message that displays the text alongside the downloading animation instead of the picture. This did not change even after I have a stable connection for a couple of hours. I necessary, I can provide the error log.

buginformation.summary: App exit transition animation inconsistent
buginformation.description: The transition animation when the app exists is inconsistent depending on which view you are on. Steps: Open the app (opens to message/text view list) Press home button to exit App exits with zoom out transition animation Again open app and click on any message to open one Press home button to exit App exits with slide to right transition animation (jarring to eyes) Device: Moto G Kit Kat 4.4.2

buginformation.summary: Actionbar locale for single/multi contact selection not changing until restart
buginformation.description: If you switch the selected language the title in the action bar is not translate until restart. It keeps the language that was set on startup. started in spanish, and switched to french Would have fixed that, but @mcginty is heavily working on that region so I issued this first.

buginformation.summary: [bug] Forwarding media messages only forwards text
buginformation.description: Sharing pictures from the gallery or anywhere else works great in 2.0.7., but whenever I want to forward a message with an image, only the text gets transferred into the new message. Observed behaviour: Forwarding messages with pictures only forwards the text. Expected behaviour: Forwarding messages with pictures forwards the whole message. @McLoo identified the problem in ConversationFragment.java (#316 (comment)): private void handleForwardMessage(MessageRecord message) { Intent composeIntent = new Intent(getActivity(), ShareActivity.class); composeIntent.putExtra(ConversationActivity.DRAFT_TEXT_EXTRA, message.getDisplayBody().toString()); composeIntent.putExtra(ShareActivity.MASTER_SECRET_EXTRA, masterSecret); startActivity(composeIntent); }

buginformation.summary: Crash when receiving MMS
buginformation.description: This just started in the past couple of days, every time an MMS comes in, TextSecure crashes. My setup is a bit strange since I'm using t-mobile's network with a phone originally designed for AT&T. Recipients of my MMS messages get the "adaptation" error, but this crash when I receive one is new to me. Here's the debug log that I ran just after the crash/app reboot: http://hastebin.com/xitukakiqa

buginformation.summary: [Bug ?] Key changed events do not generate a notification
buginformation.description: I encountered this with a friend of mine who reflashed his phone and subsequently reregistered. I had an ongoing chat (using his old key) with him and noticed today that he had sent me a message yesterday and I had to accept the new key. But I didn't get notified about the new message in the notification bar I would expect Textsecure to generate notifications for all events including the key changed event, since this may lead to unnoticed messages, depending on usage pattern of course. If this behaviour is intentional, it would be great to know the rationale behind this. Anyways I want to thank you for your amazing work! Steps to reproduce: User A and User B both register with Textsecure Both Users exchange a couple of messages User B reregisters with Textsecure changing his key User B send User A a Message No notification is shown on User A's device Expected behaviour: User A should be notified of the incoming message with the new key

buginformation.summary: strange menu item text
buginformation.description: there is "Get scanned to compare" (just below "Scan to compare") which was not understandable to me (as a non-native speaker, but I suspect native speaker might have issues, too). suggestion: show QR code (to compare)

buginformation.summary: Can't send SMS to numbers with MS Outlook phone number format
buginformation.description: I'm trying out TextSecure for the first time and wanted to send SMS to friends, who's contacts are stored in my exchange account. The numbers were entered in MS Outlook and are stored in this (year long default) format: +xx (xxx) xxxxxxx The sending of the message fails without giving a reason. (I can text these people with the on-board messaging app and I can call them, so the number is correct.) After playing around a bit, I noticed that the parentheses seem to be the culprit. Any other Android app silently discards them and dials the number. I added a new number manually (without parentheses) and things worked out just fine. Then I changed the number of the aforementioned friend to not contain the parentheses anymore in my address book and tried to re-add him to TextSecure. Unfortunately TextSecure somehow caches the old/other number somewhere and I'm not able to enter his number in any way. Neither by selecting it from the (now updated) address book, nor by entering it manually without any special characters. I guess #791 is related here. Both problems are real show stoppers for using TextSecure. (I'm not able to update all phone numbers in the corporate phone book ;-)) Device-Specs: Alcatel One Touch Idol X+ Dual SIM (but just using 1 SIM currently) Android: 4.2.2

buginformation.summary: Back Stack Issues
buginformation.description: If I click back on a message, I often see the same message multiple times. A single message should only be in the back stack once. Also after clicking a notification, clicking back should return you to your previous app, now cycle you through all activity of TextSecure.

buginformation.summary: MMS doesn't work unless you enter override settings
buginformation.description: Well it's as the title says, I only realised this after searching Google. That's a terrible thing. FYI, I had to enter http://mmsc.t-mobile.co.uk:8002 149.254.201.135 8080

buginformation.summary: TextSecure stops receiving messages after being closed from 'recent apps' list
buginformation.description: Open TS & enter passphrase Go to homescreen or another app Press/hold 'home' softkey/on-screen button Remove TS from the list by swiping it left/right Messages now go to native Android client rather than TS Device: Samsung Galaxy S2 (Hercules/SGH-T989) OS: Android 4.2.2

buginformation.summary: MMS MSISDN/Line1 headers missing
buginformation.description: I'm new to using TextSecure and I'm sorry if this is a dupe but I couldn't find a similar issue. I just made TextSecure my default messaging app and when trying to download an MMS image, I receive "Error connecting to MMS provider..." I used the following manual MMS settings, as found in my phone's system menu (##3282#): MMSC URL: http://mmsc.vmobl.com:8088 MMS Proxy Host: 68.28.31.2 MMS Proxy Port: 80 A debug log can be found at http://hastebin.com/idofelenev I think the log cut off the attempt to download MMS with the proxy, but in previous attempts it looked similar. Virgin Mobile US, Android 4.4.2, TextSecure 2.1.8

buginformation.summary: MMS sending (and receiving) fails if on WiFi and APN is set to IPv6
buginformation.description: Hello, I am having trouble sending and receiving MMS on my T-Mobile USA Samsung galaxy S4 (Android 4.4.4) while connected to WiFi. I am using TextSecure 2.1.8. It looks like the problems have something to do with the switch from IPv4 (on WiFi) to IPv6 on the cellular network. If I manually disable WiFi and send a MMS through TextSecure on the IPv6 only APN, the MMS is correctly sent and received. If I manually switch the APN to IPv4 only, then TextSecure correctly sends and receives MMS while connected to WiFi (by transitioning to the cellular network to send the MMS). However, if I use the default APN of the phone (IPv6 only) and I am connected to the IPv4 only WiFi, sending fails. The logs show that TextSecure attempts to connect to the cellular, but then times out connecting to the MMSC (2607:7700:0:5::ab8:4b81) because of Network unreachable.

buginformation.summary: Search doesnt find groups
buginformation.description: Groups that are visible in the regular conversations view are not found when searching for their names. Its probably the same issue that has been pointed out here http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/questions/8473126-can-t-see-send-to-groups I am quite sure that this was not the case back in July. If I recall correctly then it was also possible to find the groups in the contacts screen (the one that pops up when hitting +). Device info: HTC Desire HD, Cyanogenmod 7.3, TextSecure 2.1.8

buginformation.summary: Enter key does not send
buginformation.description: Hitting enter simply makes a carriage return and does not send a text. This is despite the "Enter key sends" setting being checked. I'm using version 14.0.9 on Android 5.0.1. Thanks.

buginformation.summary: hidden conversation when all messages deleted before writing new ones
buginformation.description: enter existing conversation delete all messages right(at least it sounds similar) write a new one exit conversation --> not in conversation list

buginformation.summary: notification unread message when locking textsecure
buginformation.description: Evertytime I lock TextSecure I get a notification about an unread message from a certain contact (always the same contact), but it is wrong as I already have read all messages.

buginformation.summary: Difficult to select some messages
buginformation.description: After I upgraded from 2.3.3 to 2.4.0 I have difficulties selecting some messages. Not all messages - it seems to be just those messages where TextSecure recognises a phonenumber in the message text. When I long-press such a message and release my finger from the screen the selection disappears. To select such a message I have to long press, don't release my finger, press another message in the thread so I select 2 messages and then short-press the last one so it leaves the selection. Update: I tested this on 2 devices, one no-name cheap Android 4.2.2 which does not have this problem. A Sony XPeria Z1 Compact with 4.4.4 does have this problem.

buginformation.summary: share / add attachment: picture == > crash
buginformation.description: same problem still existing! .... was closed on thread #2248 (i didnt know if should open a new one again or post in closed. couldnt find in guidelines) what happened there on the closed thread? i dont see the progress. cheers Device : Samsung GT-I9305 (m3xx) Android: omni_i9305-userdebug 4.4.4 KTU84P 440 test-keys App : TextSecure 2.4.2 when i send a picture from gallery / or as attachment out of TS or from my camera. it crashes. can someone confirm this? log: https://gist.github.com/d0195640abc36b4f8cf5

buginformation.summary: "Error sending message" if group member uninstalls TextSecure
buginformation.description: In a group chat, a member removed TextSecure or unregistered from the service. Since then, all messages yield to "Error sending message" although the other remaining group members receive the messages successfully. I also did not find a way to remove that member from the group. In the log I get these exceptions: W/TextSecureMessageSender( 3082): org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.push.exceptions.UnregisteredUserException: buginformation.summary: MasterSecretUtil salt size of 8 bytes below NIST recommended minimum of 16 bytes
buginformation.description: The generateSalt() method in MasterSecretUtil uses 8 bytes (64 bits) while NIST recommends a minimum of 16 bytes (128 bits). https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/crypto/MasterSecretUtil.java#L235 NIST documentation "Recommendation for Password-Based Key Derivation Part 1: Storage Applications" - http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/800-132/nist-sp800-132.pdf NIST documentation excerpt from page 10, "5.1 The Salt (S) All or a portion of the salt shall be generated using an approved Random Bit Generator (e.g., see [5]). The length of the randomly-generated portion of the salt shall be at least 128 bits." Can this be adjusted to at least 128 bits by changing new byte[8] to new byte[16]?

buginformation.summary: Mark/Select picture attachment at conversation - problems.
buginformation.description: Hi folks, when i try to select an attachment (picture) at the conversation while pressing "ON" the picture, it gets marked but as soon i release my finger from the screen the picture automaticly gets unmarked. After repeating the following steps 5-6 times he finally catched my selection. BUT! When i mark next to the picture, on the blank screen, it gets marked immediately. U need a log for this?

buginformation.summary: Missing notifications in Priority Mode / Lollipop
buginformation.description: When I enable "Priority" mode in Lollipop, the phone won't ring/vibrate, as expected. But I wanted to enable the "ring for starred contacts", for messages as well as incoming calls. It works with the AOSP messaging app, but it doesn't work with TS. Is there a way to fix this? Thx! TextSecure 2.5.3 / LG G3 (d855) / CyanogenMod 12 App state: Push registered, incoming SMS enabled (default app), outgoing SMS enabled

buginformation.summary: notifications for group messages
buginformation.description: when multiple people post new messages in a group chat, the notification on android assigns them all to the first person that posted. Only when I open the app, I learn that they are from multiple people. Maybe it would be more straightforward to show the group name in notifications instead?

buginformation.summary: Add sms: uri schema handler
buginformation.description: If I click on an sms hyperlink in a web browser (such as Call me, maybe? textsecure does not come up as an option. Since you can only send sms from your default sms app, this makes it so these links essentially are unusable when textsecure is your default sms app. Note: smsto: does not work either.

buginformation.summary: Adding an invite should not replace a draft message
buginformation.description: It should be appended to the draft instead, otherwise it's a dataloss.

buginformation.summary: Notification can show incorrect message receipt time
buginformation.description: If I have a notification for two (or more) messages from different senders, the notification correctly displays the time of the most recent message. However, if I read this second message without reading the first one, the notification time is updated to the time that I read the second message, rather than the receipt time of the first message.

buginformation.summary: new message to does not appear if incoming sms disabled
buginformation.description: Currently, the recipient must be in the sender's contacts. Though only a minor inconvenience for those of us that do not wish to sync any personal information with Google's servers, it seems like a rather arbitrary restriction.

buginformation.summary: Dates are displayed in system locale regardless of language setting
buginformation.description: Currently all the dates and times are diplayed regarding the android system locale using DateUtils.formatDateTime. Sometimes its even mixed because the plurals hours_ago and minutes_ago are translated. My system language is set to german but I'm using TextSecure in english: It would be more consistent if the dates are formatted regarding the textsecure language setting I guess.

buginformation.summary: Message Details v2.7.0b1
buginformation.description: There's no scrolling in Message Details. A long SMS does fill the screen, isn't fully displayed, and the details aren't shown. Regards C

buginformation.summary: ClassCastException for MMS notification records
buginformation.description: v2.7.0-b1 https://gist.github.com/18eb6203060d8d58a07a

buginformation.summary: Emoji pane losing history
buginformation.description: Hi! Since version 2.6, TextSecure loses the emoji history (last used emojis) from time to time. Never happened before with older version. Thanks for your great work!

buginformation.summary: [2.6.4] No notifications shown on new message receive
buginformation.description: After updating to version 2.6.4 from 2.5.x via Google Play Store no notifications about new received messages were shown when application runs in the background. The notifications and the messages are only received when running the the foregound, which leads to missed messages. This is new with 2.6.4, I never had the problem with any previous version. Samsung GT-i9505 (jfltexx) Android 4.4.4 (KOT49H.I9505XXUGNK4) OS Host: SWDD6301 TextSecure 2.6.4

buginformation.summary: Video needs to be saved on disc to be playbacked
buginformation.description: I received a MP4 file from an iOS user (don't know if that has an impact); by trying to playback out of the conversation with vlc i received an error message: can not connect to file, please try to update media db. After saving the file playback was possible on my Nexus 4 running LRX22C version 2.6.4.

buginformation.summary: Messages sent to group delivered to private chat after the sender uses a new PreKey
buginformation.description: Sender's Device: LG G3 running Lolipop, TextSecure 2.6.4 / 2.7.1 (not sure) Receiver's Device: Nexus 5 running Lolipop, TextSecure 2.7.1 Issue details: An existing TextSecure user switched to a new phone and installed TextSecure on it The user sent a message to an existing group member which accepted his new identity then added him to the group. Other group members did not yet approve his new identity. Whenever the user with a new identity sends a message to the group, users who didn't yet accept his new identity receive a "private chat notification" asking them to confirm his unknown identity or cancel. after confirming each "confirm identity" notification, the message which was supposed to be delivered to the group is delivered to the private chat instead of group chat. no idea about future messages, but i believe they would be delivered normally to the group after confirming the identity.

buginformation.summary: Zero character passphrases?
buginformation.description: Textsecure 2.7.1 Samsung SGH-T399 Android 4.2.2 When setting up a passphrase, textsecure accepts a passphrase that is zero characters long. From a usability standpoint and to avoid confusion, it seems like we should require passphrases to be at least one character long. What do people think?

buginformation.summary: Selecting failed messages is impossible
buginformation.description: -send a message and make it fail (somehow) -try to select the message to delete it The only workaround I found is to select another message first, then select the failed one, deselect the first one and then delete the failed one Thank you

buginformation.summary: Notification sound doesn't work upon installation
buginformation.description: I noticed after installation that when I receive messages, it didn't make a sound, it only flashed the notification light. I go to Settings -> Notifications, and I can see "Sound = Argon" is displayed. I press on 'Sound', which takes me to the sound selection list, but here there is none selected. I now select Argon from the list, back in settings it says "Sound = Argon" as before, but from now the app is making notification sounds. My colleague also had the same problem.

buginformation.summary: ConversationItem manipulating view in wrong thread
buginformation.description: If there is ever an error while resolving a conversation item thumbnail then ConversationItem.ThumbnailListener will get a callback to onFailure() which will in turn trigger an uncaught android.view.ViewRoot$CalledFromWrongThreadException exception. https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ConversationItem.java#L615 call should be moved into handler.post(...)

buginformation.summary: Can't share to TextSecure via the share intent
buginformation.description: As of 0ff9925 ("move routing logic to all activities"), sharing via an intent doesn't work. To reproduce: Share some text to TextSecure (via some other app's "Share" functionality) TextSecure will show the "Share with" menu with some contacts (and a plus button) Tap a contact (or tap the plus button and select one from the list) The contact's thread will open (or if it was a new contact, a new thread will be created), but the shared text won't be prefilled in the text box. Android 4.4.4 (CM11), commit 0ff9925 .

buginformation.summary: Bad multi-recipient notification behavior
buginformation.description: Tapping on a TextSecure notification with multiple senders now opens something that says it's a group chat with 0 members, rather than opening to the ConversationList. I assume this is a regression caused by the RoutingActivity change. I don't know what happens if you try to respond in that group thread, but it can't be good. We should probably try to get a 2.10.1 out asap.

buginformation.summary: forward message to contact for which you have no existing conversation, broken.
buginformation.description: open some conversation select some text message in that conversation click "Forward message" select a contact for which you don't have an existing conversation action bar updates as expected but conversation view still shows messages from original thread

buginformation.summary: Visible glitch when toggling between keyboard and built-in Emoji drawer
buginformation.description: Hello, when toggling between the keyboard and the TextSecure Emoji drawer, the TextSecure Emoji drawer appears above the keyboard for a brief momen and "fades" into the keyboard, which looks like a glitch and is uneasy on the eyes. In Telegram for Android, that does not happen. In Telegram for Android, when toggling between the built-in Emoji drawer and the keyboard, the toggle happens instantly, the Emoji drawer instantly replaces the keyboard, without any transition or whatever, which looks much smoother. In TextSecure it currently looks buggy and is quite uneasy on the eyes. Could you please fix it? Regards

buginformation.summary: Long-pressing emoji backspace deletes only one character
buginformation.description: Another lovely emoji keyboard related issue: If you want to remove ten characters with the emoji drawer's backspace you have to tap it ten times. Long press does not work. Compare to the regular keyboards' backspace which you can tap and hold to remove everything at once. Tested with: TS 2.11.0, Android 5.0.1, Android 4.0.4

buginformation.summary: Emojis appear dissected / cut off / stretched
buginformation.description: Hello, the Emojis randomly appear dissected / cut off / stretched on the TextSecure Emoji drawer. It happens regardless of the system font size, as you can see in the following screenshots: System font size @ minimum: System font size @ medium: System font size @ maximum: So, I don't know what triggers it. It actually even happened the very first time I opened the Emoji drawer after having upgraded from TextSecure 2.9.3 to TextSecure 2.10.2. Closing TextSecure via the task manager and then reopening it seems to solve it at first, but the issue seems to randomly reappear. Happening on LG G2 with stock 4.4.2 KitKat. Could you please fix it? Regards

buginformation.summary: "There are four lights!" or How conversation list's 'select all' disregards search results
buginformation.description: Go to your conversation list Search for some subset of your conversations Tap and hold to select at least one of the conversations from the search results Now tap 'select all' from the top right corner TS will select all of your conversations instead of just all the search results (6. If you want to live dangerously try to delete the selected messages by tapping the trash bin. It will remove all conversations. This proves that it really selects all conversations and not just misrepresent the number of selected messages.) A .gif demonstration (does not strictly follow the above steps): TS 2.11.1, Android 5.0.1 and also 4.0.4

buginformation.summary: NPE: ThumbnailView, tap preview icon when file not found
buginformation.description: encountered this while running an unmodified debug build of 27a5b7d sequence of events were: send a bunch of text messages send a bunch of media messages do the same while screwing around with airplane mode attach image image preview is an error icon (may have been ic_action_warning_red or ic_missing_thumbnail_picture, can't remember) click on error image preview crash I then tried to reproduce by simply returning to the convo and reattaching the same image, crash again. Did this a few more times and once the image preview was entirely blank (but still took up the space it should), clicked on that too, crash. While in this crashable state I attempted to reproduce this using a different attachment, no crash. Thinking it may have had something to do with cache I tried another different image that definitely should not have been in cache, also no crash. buginformation.summary: Thumbnails not rendering
buginformation.description: Built a RC and tried sending a few images. This happens every so often, where the entire message bubble (except for the arrow) fails to render:

buginformation.summary: Sending a deleted image gets stuck in pending state
buginformation.description: This came up in #3046 briefly. Sometimes when you delete a picture it will leave around ghost thumbnails that are visible in the system gallery and also in TS attachment gallery. This can lead to the following issue if you try to send the deleted image: Delete a picture that's on your device with shell or a file manager (or create a ghost thumbnail in some other way) Attach that picture to a TS message using the attachment gallery's Recent tab (the gallery does not know that the picture was deleted) You will get a missing thumbnail icon Tap send TS will create an "empty" message that gets stuck in a pending state for eternity If you try to do the same in Google Hangouts you will get a 'Can't find picture' notification and you cannot send the image. TextSecure should also check if the file exists and not trust the gallery viewer. .gif demonstration: TS 2.12.0, stock Android 5.1 and Android 4.0.4

buginformation.summary: delete thread on new conversation appears to do nothing
buginformation.description: 2.12.0 from play store. unexpected behavior 00: click the new conversation button select a contact for which no conversation exists options menu > delete thread > yes nothing happens unexpected behavior 01: click the new conversation button select a contact for which no conversation exists create a draft but don't leave the conversation options menu > delete thread > yes nothing happens the behavior I expect is to be returned to the conversation list view and not see any sign of the previous new conversation, this goes well if a draft is saved for the conversation like so: click the new conversation button select a contact for which no conversation exists create a draft go back to conversation list view reopen the new conversation options menu > delete thread > yes thread deleted and returned to conversation list view

buginformation.summary: Date format does not respect locale
buginformation.description: Currently TS seems to display all dates in the format MMM d, yyyy irrespective of the locale. The dates are translated correctly though. Here's some information about date formats in various regions: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Date_format_by_country TS 2.13.0 This issue does not depend on whether you have changed the system language or TS language. Neither work.

buginformation.summary: Update the default led notification color to match the current UI
buginformation.description: This is such a minor issue that it feels almost a sin reporting this but sometimes details are important. Currently the default led notification color is green. However the only green left in TextSecure are the message bubbles when using unencrypted SMS. Otherwise TextSecure is all about blue now (icon, UI, push messages). Therefore the default led color should follow suit.

buginformation.summary: message notification contact photo solid white for contact with no picture
buginformation.description: built from 4ad9d6b running on my Nexus 5, Lollipop 5.1 in the conversation list view contact "lol myself" has no associated image, so an avatar is generated, the output is pink and the letter "l". however when I receive a message form "lol myself" the generated avatar is not shown in the message notification, in its place is only white.

buginformation.summary: Cursor not shown when typing a message
buginformation.description: You know the little pulsing bar that appears when writing something in a text box? (I'm sure i thas a name but I can't think of a better description right now). Since 2.14.1 (probably 2.14) it has disappeared from textsecure. This obviously makes it hard and uncomfortable to write messages.. I like textsecure, and I appreciate the effort you're putting into it, really. But do you even test the app before releasing updates? Missing commas that screw the phones and make us lose messages, huge usability problems that would've taken 10 seconds to notice... I mean... of course it's human to forget a comma or introduce bugs, we all know it. The problem is that testing should be considered fundamental, even when you have beta testers. Beta testers are supposed to find smaller problems, not sacrifice their product for the sake of bugs. That's what the developers should be doing. Apologies if it sounds rude, and thanks again.

buginformation.summary: Some avatars not rendered in contact list
buginformation.description: Go to main conversation list Tap the pen icon on the lower right to get to the contact list Tap your device's Back button to hide the keyboard that just popped up Some contact avatars do not get rendered at all This affects both picture contacts and initial creation contacts. Scrolling usually fixes the issue or moves it to another contact. It seems that if you dismiss the keyboard (step 3) quickly it increases the likelihood of missing avatars. TS 2.14.5 Nexus 4, stock Android 5.1 Huawei U8800, Android 4.0.4 Debug log: https://gist.github.com/74ba14ab06491edd4749 (On the second try 4 avatars not rendered)

buginformation.summary: units
buginformation.description: On the textSecure panel showing the list of threads, each of them has a field showing the time elapsed since the last message. typically I read something like "11 mins". I wonder what the s after min stands for. Unit for minute is min, and units do not take plural form. Unfortunately I must say that this trend of putting plural mark to units is more and more common in the US, and it appears that it is getting more common in other countries as well. Spreading that nonsense is definitely not good so I suggest that the "plural unit issue" be taken care of as soon as possible. Check also for the hour, I am pretty sure that soon some "hrs" will show up. "h" would actually be the best, while "hr" being also accepted. Thank you

buginformation.summary: Height of Emoji drawer does not match height of system keyboard
buginformation.description: Hello, using TextSecure 2.16.3 on an LG G2 running latest stock ROM (Android 5.0.2 Lollipop), the height of the Emoji drawer does not match the height of the system keyboard. The Emoji drawer is higher than the system keyboard (tested with Google Keyboard from Play Store). Could you please fix that and make the height of the Emoji drawer equal to the height of the system keyboard? Regards

buginformation.summary: Message disappears on send when sharing photo
buginformation.description: I first noticed this after the recent update to the Photos app. When sharing from within that app, a toast notification says "Sharing to TextSecure..." and the message composition process continues as expected. When sent, the message disappears. This bug does not happen when the sharing process is started from within TextSecure through either the paperclip icon or the "Add attachment" menu option. Nexus 5, Android 5.1.1 (LMY48B), T-Mobile US

buginformation.summary: Notification sound incorrectly plays when viewing a conversation from recipient
buginformation.description: With my Nexus 6 (Android 5.1) on priority mode TextSecure does not play notification sounds. This is correct. However, with my phone set up as above, if I send a message to someone and remain viewing that conversation, TextSecure will incorrectly play the notification sound if that person replies to me.

buginformation.summary: Picture message failure
buginformation.description: I am running into a problem trying to send a picture on my 1st Gen Moto X running 4.4.4. I'm using TextSecure 2.16.4 in data mode. I took a photo in potrait mode using both the camera app and the in-app option to take a photo. Both times the message will appear in the text window but fail to send. Here's a log from immediately after the failure https://gist.github.com/anonymous/52824d6ed48b2be2a32f I verified that I could send a different photo (in landscape mode) and captured another debug log here https://gist.github.com/anonymous/7f056f9973425195b26c I have tried closing and reopening TextSecure without success. It seems specific to this photo as other photos (both taken on the phone or from other sources) are able to be sent. I'm not sure if it's the subject (as other issues mentioned grass being hard to compress) or the orientation of the photo. This seems similar to #3070 or #3028. Also seems like this might have just recently been fixed in version 2.17. Sorry if this is a duplicate. Picture here

buginformation.summary: tile person images to denote group mms chats
buginformation.description: When viewing the conversation list, all mms group conversation icons only display for THE FIRST PERSON listed in the group chat. If a image is available, it will display only one contact image, otherwise if an contact image is not available, the the first letter of the first contact's first name is shown. I would like to see group chat icons in the conversation list denoted with a tile view comprised of the group contacts (possibly up to 4 tiles). It seems the special TextSecure groups have a stock grey icon to denote those type of chats since they have a group title/name. For example, if there are 3 contacts in the group MMS (2 friends plus yourself) the visual icon on the conversation list would show a vertically split tile view of your contacts photo or the Letter of their first name if a photo is not available. For reference, is similar to the Google hangout view. [][] [][] [ __ ] [][] [][] Consider similar feature for the special TextSecure group icon. version 2.16.4

buginformation.summary: TS Media Messages Received Timestamps Report Different Times
buginformation.description: Sometimes I receive an MMS (over push) when I am offline; when I finally come back online, I get the MMS message with two different received timestamps. My guess is that one timestamp corresponds to the time sent, and the other time stamp corresponds to the time received. This seems to be confusing and unnecessary information for the user, who probably only cares about when the message is sent, and doesn't understand why the time stamps are different. Device info: Sony Xperia Z3 Tablet Compact, stock android 4.4.4, TextSecure 2.21.0? (I compiled from b7492eb) App state: Push registered, incoming SMS disabled, outgoing SMS fully disabled Debug logs: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/98fe3fb59609cd429909 Example here where the last picture received has a timestamp difference of about 4 minutes, because that's how long I was offline. Both of these screenshots were taken within a minute of each other.

buginformation.summary: In the ConversationActivity, selected emoji do not match displayed emoji
buginformation.description: Phone: Moto G 2014 TS version: commit 7593918 Steps to reproduce. Open coveation Click smiley face emoji button to pull emoji drawer Attempt to make a selection while the screen is scrolled down n > 2 rows Expected outcome: The selected emoji is displayed. Actual outcome: No emoji is displayed. Incorrect emoji is displayed. Example: While the emoji selection box is scrolled exactly two lines down, clicking fearful-face yields face-savouring-delicious-food, and clicking weary-face yields face-with-medical-mask. Further, with the box scrolled exactly three lines down, clicking fearful-face yields confounded-face.

buginformation.summary: Signal crashes when notification sound is set to "none" and in-conversation notifications are enabled.
buginformation.description: Android 5.1 Signal 3.9.1 (also observed on previous versions - can't be more specific). https://gist.github.com/anonymous/291abefd9fa914074d60 If notification sound is set to "None" and "In-conversation notifications" are turned on Signal will crash whenever you receive a message while having the conversation open. This only occurs when the conversation the message is a part of is currently open. It doesn't occur if a different conversation is open or if Signal is in the background. When you re-open the app the message that caused the crash will display properly. This affects both Signal conversations and regular SMS conversations with Signal as the SMS client.

buginformation.summary: Names with accents (diacritics) wrong sorted in contact list
buginformation.description: Contact list displays names with accents in the wrong order resulting in people named "脕lvaro" being sorted after "Zacar铆as" (not able to attach image at the moment). I think COLLATE LOCALIZED in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/contacts/ContactsDatabase.java (line 150) will do the trick but i'm not a programmer. According to what I've found: [LOCALIZED] It instructs SQLite to sort non-ASCII characters appropriately. Chars with diacritics (some call them accents) have higher byte codes than the character Z, so a plain ASCII sort wouldn't fit to many foreign languages. For example, the capital A char's byte code is 0x41 and the capital Z char's is 0x5A. Then we have the 脕 (capital A accute) which code in Unicode is 0x00C1. So a plain byte code sort would result the 脕 to be after the Z. But in languages that have this kind of characters the convention is to put those with diacritics as if they didn't have the diacritic. So the 脕 should be together with the plain A, at least before B. And to illustrate, we have below a list of names sorted using their bytecode: BrendaDebbyGeorge脕lvaro脡rico Now using the COLLATE LOCALIZED it would sort by the "base" of the character: 脕lvaroBrendaDebby脡ricoGeorge" Thank you very much for your great work.

buginformation.summary: Text does not wrap when "Enter is send" is enabled
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Steps to reproduce Enable "Enter key sends" in Settings > Advanced Type a long message Text does not wrap From a UX perspective, these two things have nothing to do with each other, text could still wrap even if the input field does not allow "multiline" text, otherwise it becomes quite difficult to send long messages and the user has to break it into smaller ones, which might be annoying. Signal version: 3.11 This is not a duplicate of #4219.

buginformation.summary: Group Images are still not getting resized.
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Sending a large Image (f.i. 13MPixel, ~6MB .jpg) to a Group doesn't resize the Image to a lower dimension and filesize. When you send the same Image to a single Contact in contrary, it -does- resize the image. This leads to a large amount of traffic use on both ends. Group images should ideally be handled the same way as single contact images. In a perfect version, the user should be asked for whether it should resize the image or not. This issue has actually been found and fixed 1 year ago here BUT it is still happening in the latest Version of Signal: #2913 Steps to reproduce create a group, add one or more contacts. send a large image (13 MPixel / ~ 6 MB) to this group. Actual result: The Image is not getting resized and Signal sends a whole 6 MB image to the group. The group receives (and has to download) a full 6 MB Image. Expected result: You actually send a resized image (1280 * xxxx, ~200 KB) to that group. The group receives and downloads just a 200 KB Image. Device info Device: LG G3 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.15.2 馃憤 1

buginformation.summary: Message shown in status bar with enabled option "Display in notifications: Name only"
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The option "Name only" in the notification settings under "Display in notifications" is enabled. If you only receive messages from one person this works as intended. But if you have an unread message from one person and receive a new message from another person, the text of the second message is shown in the status bar of the phone. Steps to reproduce Change the notification settings under Notifications > Display in notifications to Name only Receive message from one person (do not read the message!) Receive message from another person Actual result: The message from the second person should appear as "New message" in the status bar of the phone Expected result: The actual message appears Device info Device: Fairphone 1U Android version: 4.2.2 Signal version: 3.16.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b314d9bf5fb0184386839b471e801f1e

buginformation.summary: Duplicate messages being received during standard TextSecure messaging (non group).
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description In standard two device messaging (signal messages, not SMS), one user receives some messages twice, however the sender doesn't see the duplicate message in their history. The log shows that around the same time, the MessageRetrievalService logs a time-out, causing it to loop around for another go. In reality both attempts seem to result in a message being rendered. Steps to reproduce Use two devices (Nexus 5 and Nexus 5x) Proceed to have a secured (TextSecure) conversation Actual result: Nexus 5 receives some messages twice. Expected result: Nexus 5 should receive exactly one message for each message the Nexus 5x sends to it. Screenshots Device info Device: LGE Nexus 5 (hammerhead) Android version: 6.0.1 (2960889, MOB30P) Signal version: Signal 3.16.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/177442603d179b543fc9ef6ac7c58ba3#file-cat-log-L229

buginformation.summary: Signal freezes on Android 7 Preview 5 when trying to add an attachment
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal was working without problems on latest Android 6.0.1 on my Nexus 6. Today I've "dirty" flashed the latest Android 7.0 Preview 5 image. I have wiped the cache partition afterwards. Signal is working on Android 7 Preview 5, but when I click the paperclip button to add an attachment, Signal freezes immediately. The blinking cursor in the text input field stops blinking and the app does not respond to any further input. After closing the app by swiping it off the recent apps list, Signal can be opened again. The same happens if I select the respective menu item instead of clicking the paperclip button. Steps to reproduce Open Signal app. Enter a conversation. Click on paperclip button or select respective menu item to add an attachment to the message. Actual result: Signal hangs/freezes immediately. The cursor stops blinking and the app does not respond to any further input. Expected result: The "attachment selection dialogue" is shown, so I can select an attachment to be added to the message. Device info Device: Motorola Nexus 6 Android version: 7.0 Preview 5 (NPD90G) Signal version: 3.16.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/a8c508d1b94d8be848149cd9025fccda 馃憤 1

buginformation.summary: InviteReminder from an SMS intent for a phone number displays the contact name from the previous InviteReminder
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description InviteReminder from an SMS intent for a phone number displays the contact name from the previous InviteReminder Steps to reproduce Open Android Dialer, choose call history tab. Click on a recent phone call you've had with a contact that has a name, (let's say "ContactName"), but that you have not used signal with, and select "Send a message" Signal opens and displays the invite reminder: "Take your conversation with ContactName to the next level." (from InviteReminder.java) Open Android Dialer, choose call history tab. Click on a recent phone call you've had with that has just a phone number listed with no contact name (let's say "PhoneNumber"), but that you have not used signal with, and select "Send a message" Signal opens and displays the invite reminder: "Take your conversation with ContactName to the next level." (from InviteReminder.java) Actual result: The InviteReminder displays the ContactName from the previous conversation. Expected result: The previous ContactName is not in the InivteReminder. It looks like the InviteReminder is generally not displayed for SMS conversations with phone numbers (no contact name), so perhaps do not display the InviteReminder in this situation. Screenshots Device info Device: Nexus 5X Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 3.17.0 Link to debug log Not included, but please let me know if you need one. 馃憤 1

buginformation.summary: Bug in new selection of notification messages (save button visible)
buginformation.description: Hi, build 3.18.0 has introduced the ability to select (and delete) notification messages. For group update messages there is a bug. If you select one the save button becomes visible. (Further on it can be clicked. The same procedure like for media messages will be initiated. However I don't know if really something is saved.) Solution: Hide save button for all kinds of notification messages. Please note that only the notification messages of self initiated group updates are affected by this bug. Notification messages of group updates from other group members are not affected. Found in build 3.18.1. 馃憤 1

Expected result: The message should be (un)marked and the audio controls should ignore they were hit.

buginformation.summary: Constantly crashing when trying to answer unknown group recovery request
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description @moxie0 I was testing #5876. The device that is trying to answer the request for unknown group details is constantly crashing on startup. Steps to reproduce Devices A and B in a group A running current beta 3.24.0, B still on 3.23.0 Re-install on device B sent group message from device A to B B receives message in unknown group update device B to Signal 3.24.0 sent another message from A to B Actual result: Device A is crashing on startup since then Expected result: Device A should answer B's request and not crash Device info Device A: Nexus 5 Android version: Stock Android 5.1.1 Signal version: see above Link to debug log I can only send a Google Feedback report after the crash. I get this in Android Studio: W/JobConsumer: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to get length of null array at java.io.ByteArrayInputStream.(ByteArrayInputStream.java:60) at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.PushGroupUpdateJob.onRun(PushGroupUpdateJob.java:68) at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) Apparently PushGroupUpdateJob is trying to attach a group avatar. The group did not have a custom avatar set. I'm really hoping for a quick fix in the beta channel. Thanks!

It seems similar to #5183, but the first exception in that case (related to the database) does not occur here. No contacts or messages are successfully synced with Desktop. buginformation.summary: Deleted group reappears when contact safety number changes
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description A deleted group shows up again when a group member's security number changes, so without exchanging messages in that group. The group then appears to be in an inactive state, i.e. sending messages is not possible. Steps to reproduce Create a group, group members A and B Delete group on device A (you can even leave the group first) Re-install Signal on device B (safety number changes) Send a message from A to B Confirm safety number change notification on device A Actual result: All deleted groups that contain B reappear on device A. The only content is a safety number change notification, see 848a256. Sending messages is not possible. Expected result: The groups should not reappear. I was surprised to see that group information where still available at all. Device info Android version: stock Android 5.1.1 Signal version: 3.24.1 馃憤 2

buginformation.summary: Crash loop on attempting to send image
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description A friend tried to send me a just then taken photo. On preparing the image for sending, signal enters a crash loop. The application becomes unsuable. The crash loop can be broken by disabling wifi and mobile internet and deleting the faulty multimedia message. Symptoms are similar to Bug #5310, the difference being that on my friends phone the error log shows an OutOfMemoryError which does not appear there. Btw: larger images sent without problems. Even though the image displays fine everywhere else, it might be faulty. Steps to reproduce Download 20161210_133710.jpg from dropbox link below to phone Check sha256 hashsum to verify it is indeed the same image that crashes Singnal on my friends Samsung Enable Wifi / Mobile Internet Send Image to another contact using Signal Actual result: Signal crashes repeatedly every few seconds when not in use or when entering the application and becomes unusable. Expected result: Signal should catch all image-processing errors and not crash. Steps to recover from error Disable Wifi / Mobile Internet Enter Signal, delete faulty Image / Message to stop Singal from crashing Image that crashes signal + Versioninfo https://www.dropbox.com/sh/ou6tintrxzw6okd/AABYd3GrkjnkS1SH0dgGl3oZa?dl=0 Device info Device: samsung SM-G900F (kltexx) Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.24.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/4257a85bab5f738c8496329c80d5d655

buginformation.summary: "Our Signal safety numbers:" string appears twice with some Share targets
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description With some Share targets, such as Twitter DMs, the string "Our Signal safety numbers:" appears twice, followed by the safety number. Steps to reproduce Go into "Conversation Settings > Verify safety numbers" Press the Share button in the upper right corner Share via Twitter DM Actual result: The string appears twice. Expected result: The string should only appear once. Screenshots Device info Signal version: 3.23.0

buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description 6308e64 introduced this, let the screenshots speak for themselves. Besides the changes you can see in the screenshots the animation when you send a message and the new bubble appears changed slightly, I think. Screenshots A wild Signal icon appears in... ... NewConversationActivity ... RecipientPreferenceActivity ... InviteActivity ... GiphyActivity Mind the gap between back arrow and recipient, before 6308e64 After 6308e64 馃憤 1 馃槃 1

buginformation.summary: Image "stickers and scribbles" OOM error, preventable?
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I was testing "Support for stickers and scribbles" (1b44bdc) on a phone that has (only) 768MB of RAM. The picture to be edited was a 3000 * 4000 pixel (w * h) ~1.9MB jpg. Tapping confirm after minimal editing resulted in a OOM error. I got back to the conversation screen and conversation list by tapping the Android back button. Entering the conversation again from the conversation list then let me sent unsecured SMS only, which is a bad experience. Fortunately "force stop" Signal solves the issue. I wonder if the process would succeed if pictures were scaled before editing? Sending the same picture without prior editing works as expected. buginformation.summary: AvatarDownloadJob NPE when trying to open Signal
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Someone in a group tried to update the group avatar but apparently, something went wrong. Signal Desktop now shows a black avatar in the conversation list and the default avatar in the top bar, while Signal-Android crashes with a NPE in AvatarDownloadJob unless I go into airplane mode. Device info Android version: 4.2.2 Signal version: 3.25.2 Link to debug log E/AndroidRuntime( 3089): FATAL EXCEPTION: JobConsumer-0E/AndroidRuntime( 3089): java.lang.NullPointerExceptionE/AndroidRuntime( 3089): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.AvatarDownloadJob.onRun(AvatarDownloadJob.java:73)E/AndroidRuntime( 3089): at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18)E/AndroidRuntime( 3089): at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76)E/AndroidRuntime( 3089): at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) Full log: https://gist.github.com/haffenloher/977931ea330143a0cf8b41dea390ce04

buginformation.summary: Voice note recording cancels immediately if Android phone is set to Arabic language
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates, only RTL language issue is (#4714) and did not see this in voice note issues read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Voice note recording to other Signal user does not record and cancels immediately if phone language is set to Arabic Steps to reproduce Set phone language to Arabic Open thread with a Signal contact Press mic to record voice message Actual result: Nothing records. option immediately closes Expected result: Record and send voice note Screenshots Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S7 Android version: 3.25.3 Signal version: 6.0.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/26a9adbe482848aa98499c648e0d6e1d

buginformation.summary: After leaving a group I can still change disappearing messages setting
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I am in a group chat with someone and when I leave the group I am still able to change disappearing messages setting. Steps to reproduce become a part of a group chat leave a group choose disappearing messages from menu change a setting Actual result: Group members are sending messages with new setting. Expected result: Disappearing messages settings can be changed only be existing members of a group chat. Device info Device: Multiple Android version: 4.3+ Signal version: 3.25.4

buginformation.summary: Archive title is not updated after language change
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The title of the archived conversations activity is not translated to the language that is set at the moment. Instead it shows up in the language that was set during your first visit to this activity. Steps to reproduce Open Signal Enter archive Go back to conversation list Change language in Settings -> Appearance to any other language Go back to conversation list Enter archive Actual result: The title has the language which was set during your first visit to the archive. Expected result: The title has the language which is set at the moment. Screenshots Device info Device: Fairphone 2 Android version: 5.1.1 Signal version: 3.25.4 馃憤 2

The original issue was turned into this issue from the second comment. Original issue below for posterity: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description App crashes. Steps to reproduce Unable to reproduce. This happened twice within a short timespan as I was using the app. Strangely, the action I was performing at the time (1st crash: sending a photo captured within Signal to a group conversation, 2nd crash: responding to a text message to a single contact) was successful both times, even though the app reported that it crashed. Actual result: App crashes and has to be relaunched. Expected result: App should not crash, messages should be sent. Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S5 Neo Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.25.4 Link to debug log 1st crash: https://gist.github.com/cec3a81959ce454cce66fab9da1644db 2nd crash: https://gist.github.com/a2cddcbc9aeb725918025e7b14e0e991 PS: I also submitted the Google app crash report thing, not sure if that's useful to the OWS crowd.

buginformation.summary: Crash after sharing xlsx as jpg
buginformation.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal crashes after sending a shared Excel-file (xlsx) which has been renamed to end with jpg. Afterwards it can't be used anymore. Steps to reproduce Rename a xyz.xlsx (Excel-File) to xyz.xlsx.jpg Share xyz.xlsx.jpg via signal to a contact Press the send button (The app crashes) Try to reopen the app Actual result: The app crashes in step 3 and can't be opened afterwards (step 4). The apps can only be restored to work with deleting all data via the android settings. Expected result: The best would be support xlsx files to be supported. The minimum requirement in my opinion is that the app rejects shared files that are not supported and doesn't keep crashing in this case. Screenshots n.a. Device info Device: Aquaris M5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.26.2 Link to debug log A debug log can't be captured as signal crashes immediately after any restart attemp.

buginformation.summary: It is not possible to set a group avatar
buginformation.description: Hello, thanks for your great work. On my CM11 phone it is not possible to set a group avatar. Clicking on the empty group avatar wil open the "image selecting form", but whatever i choose, the group avatar stays empty after selection. Bedt regards, Deccoy

buginformation.summary: Alphanumeric addresses in SMS messages
buginformation.description: My carrier and some other companies sometimes send SMS with alphanumeric addresses. When TextSecure receives them, it shows sender as Anonymous. Also, it won't import them from system database (i. e. SMS will not show in TextSecure in any way). I have saved few such messages on my phone (Galaxy Nexus) and I know a tiny bit about Android development, so if there anything I can check/send to help resolve the issue, I will be glad to help.

buginformation.summary: Lower compression for sent pictures
buginformation.description: It would be nice if pictures which are sent over the data channel aren't so highly compressed. 馃憤 3

buginformation.summary: Group chat: Can't send message or leave group after being added a second time
buginformation.description: Person A creates new group, invites persons B and C and sends message. B leaves group after sending a message and deletes group thread. A adds B again to group. B now gets new group messages, but can't leave again or send any more messages to group. Happened to me on a Galaxy S4 with Android 4.3. I can delete the group thread, but it will appear again as soon as a new message is posted to the group.

buginformation.summary: Wrong image in chat preview
buginformation.description: Hello, when I send an image, in the chat there is shown an image I sent before instead of the right one I just have sent. When it is clicked, the right one is shown in full screen. Even when I delete the conversation and I send a new image, the old wrong picture is shown in chat. (Fullscreen shows the right image). Does Deletion of conversation not delete data of the conversation? Greets
